alert.note: Alert for Wheatland (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 12 at 1:53AM MDT until further notice by NWS Billings
info.description: .Snow melt from the base of the Crazy Mountains has resulted in minor flooding across portions of northern Sweet Grass County. Additional snow melt due to yesterday`s very warm temperatures will likely push water levels on small creeks and streams slightly higher this morning. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Portions of central and south central Montana, including the following counties, in central Montana, Wheatland. In south central Montana, Sweet Grass. * WHEN...Until 330 PM MDT today. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding of small creeks and streams, low-lying areas, and culverts. Rural roads and bridges may be washed out or damaged. Livestock may become stranded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 149 AM MDT, Minor flooding from snowmelt along Otter Creek and Cooney Creek continues. Minor flooding is possible on additional small streams. - Some locations that could experience flooding include... Melville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Do not drive on or attempt to cross flooded roads, find an alternate route. Roads and driveways may be damaged or washed out in places.
